title: How to get a job as a voice of a Champion?
body:
It came as an idea because my boyfriend has a really strong, deep, clear voice and it sounds Demacian-like.

Most of the league voices I’ve seen recently have either ONLY done league or have a super small resume compared to voice acting in TV/anime/movies.

Does anyone know how the voice actors for league champions were found? Did Riot put out an ad or something simple or is it more complex than that? Did they need to only come in for a day or two? I know some voice actors for league have reprised their voices multiple times but others kind of fell off the face of the earth...

Thanks ahead of time!

replies.body:
They contact agencies. You need to establish a reputation and your agency will have a history of voices you have done. When Riot sends out a request to agencies looking for someone with a certain range, experience, and availability, they pretty much choose their best option. Not sure if they do auditions or if they just pick and roll with it, but it's a process that someone simply can't waltz into like that, unfortunately.

This is speaking as someone who does voice work, and I tell you it's not easy to land a role as a champion in a big-name game like League of Legends unless you luck out hugely.

Although, if you attend a lot of Riot events and get active, you can establish some connections to kind of streamline the process and make yourself known to them.

Mostly.

80% We contact agencies as listed (Sometimes specifically calling out an actor we want to hear) and sometimes backdooring a rioter or actor we’ve used before (20%) (obviously excluding skins)

Our VO team selects a number of candidates. Then we do at least 2 rounds of auditions.  (Blind then directed).  Generally narrowing to top 10-15 picks then down to top 2-3 . 

The final round is used as temp track to get internal feedback.
